dcterms:title: Apoptotic stress causes mtDNA release during senescence and drives the SASP
dcterms:abstract: Senescent cells drive age-related tissue dysfunction partially through the induction of a chronic senescence-associated secretory phenotype (SASP). Mitochondria are major regulators of the SASP; however, the underlying mechanisms have not been elucidated. Here we find that mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization (MOMP) occurring in a subset of mitochondria is a feature of cellular senescence. This process, called minority MOMP (miMOMP), requires BAX and BAK macropores enabling the release of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) into the cytosol.
